intro: Ducrosia flabellifolia, commonly known as the fan-leaf ducrosia, is a striking perennial plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that resemble a fan, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in the spring. Ducrosia flabellifolia thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in temperate climates. Its unique foliage and vibrant flowers make it a standout addition to any landscape.
